intro: Haloragis microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and the edges of water bodies. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal regions. Haloragis microphylla is adapted to saline and waterlogged soils, making it an important species in aquatic ecosystems.
